subject: Music
title: Ella Fitzgerald's Voice
description: A quick win: understand Ella Fitzgerald's Voice.

hook.text: Ella Fitzgerald could scat sing so fast and precisely that horn players couldn't keep up.

buildup.text: She won an amateur contest at the Apollo Theater at 17 and never looked back.

discovery.text: Her voice had three octaves of range with perfect pitch and flawless tone.

twist.text: Despite her talent, segregation meant she was often barred from the hotels where she performed.

climax.text: Her Great American Songbook albums remain the definitive versions of those classic songs.

punchline.text: They called her the First Lady of Song. Nobody argued.

quiz.question: What was Ella Fitzgerald famous for?
options: Her extraordinary vocal range, scat singing, and Songbook albums
